c.c: This is a set of tests for pandoc. Most of them are adapted from John Gruber’s markdown test suite.
In Markdown 1.0.0 and earlier. Version 8. This line turns into a list item. Because a hard-wrapped line in the middle of a paragraph looked like a list item.
Here’s one with a bullet. * criminey.
There should be a hard line break
This is a block quote. It is pretty short.
This should not be a block quote: 2 > 1.

c:
this code block is indented by two tabs

These should not be escaped:  \$ \\ \> \[ \{

c.c: Item 1. graf two. The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog’s back.
this is a list item indented with tabs
this is a list item indented with spaces
this is an example list item indented with tabs
this is an example list item indented with spaces
sublist with roman numerals, starting with 4
A. Upper Alpha I. Upper Roman. (6) Decimal start with 6 c) Lower alpha with paren
Should not be a list item:
contains seeds, crisp, pleasant to taste
Blank line after term, indented marker, alternate markers:
This should be a code block, though:
This should just be an HTML comment:
Just plain comment, with trailing spaces on the line:
These should not be superscripts or subscripts, because of the unescaped spaces: a^b c^d, a~b c~d.
are names of trees. So is
Here’s one that has a line break in it:
To get the famous equation, write
of money. So is $34,000. (It worked if
AT&T has an ampersand in their name.
AT&T is another way to write it.
by itself should be a link.
link with an ampersand in the URL
Here’s a link with an amersand in the link text:
Here is the footnote. It can go anywhere after the footnote reference. It need not be placed at the end of the document.
Here’s the long note. This one contains multiple blocks.
Subsequent blocks are indented to show that they belong to the footnote (as with list items).
If you want, you can indent every line, but you can also be lazy and just indent the first line of each block.
be a footnote reference, because it contains a space.[^my note] Here is an inline note.
to type. Inline notes may contain
verbatim characters, as well as [bracketed text].
This paragraph should not be part of the note, as it is not indented.
